{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3316040,"name":"That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic","username":"Domm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domm/{size}/220499_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-23T17:16:59.135Z","cooked":"

Hi! We are having an issue currently with our CANivore system (as it runs our drive train.) and we’ve been having issues with it since we swapped from falcon drive motors on our SDS Mk4’s to Krakens and powering our CANcoders off of their break-out boards by WCP. The main question I have is that even though Krakens use the same type of motor controller as Falcons, has anyone had any issues with them not being as reliable or consistent as Falcons?

This is also a little bit of a two part question as well but- I noticed on WCP website they recommend using 10 AWG wire for Krakens. Our team uses 12 AWG wire on all of our larger motors (Neos, Falcons, etc.) and was wondering if that may effect the CANcoder break-out board reliability since that’s how we both power and get CAN to our CANcoders.

If anyone has any input on either of these topics please reach-out as anything is appreciated. Thank you!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-02-23T17:16:59.135Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":460,"reads":348,"readers_count":347,"score":2369.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":455892,"topic_slug":"kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg","display_username":"That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56935,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 93 - Pit/Electrical Lead"},"post_url":"/t/kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg/455892/1","custom_user_title":"Team 93 - Pit/Electrical Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3316048,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-23T17:29:08.046Z","cooked":"

What specifically are the weird bugs your experiencing? I believe the cancoder adaptor for the kraken basically just provides power and CAN for the cancoder. Nothing different than wiring it to robot normally

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-02-23T17:29:08.046Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":311,"readers_count":310,"score":87.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":455892,"topic_slug":"kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg/455892/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3316223,"name":"That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic","username":"Domm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domm/{size}/220499_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-23T20:50:56.677Z","cooked":"

The main two issues we’ve had with the CANcoders after swapping to the adapter for power and CAN has been lower/dimmer LED’s than they’ve usually been. Like half of the brightness they used to be sometimes, and when everything was starting to work before we also had an issue where whenever a drive motor moved the CANcoder stated loosing ticks consistently. Only when a drive motor moved though. If one of our steering motors started turning (we use falcons for steer motors) or the robot was shaken or anything like that we didn’t have any issues.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-02-23T20:50:56.677Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":252,"readers_count":251,"score":80.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":455892,"topic_slug":"kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg","display_username":"That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":20021,"username":"Chadfrom7226","name":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56935,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 93 - Pit/Electrical Lead"},"post_url":"/t/kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg/455892/3","custom_user_title":"Team 93 - Pit/Electrical Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3316466,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-24T03:24:36.333Z","cooked":"

It’s probably worth making sure you are getting CANcoder power from the steering motors, since they should always be drawing relatively low current, especially compared to drive motors. 10 vs. 12 AWG shouldn’t make the kind of difference you can see in dimmer LEDs, but check the quality of your electrical construction, especially if it’s worse on some of the modules.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-02-24T03:24:36.333Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":81.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":455892,"topic_slug":"kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg/455892/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3316560,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-24T08:20:54.737Z","cooked":"

Losing positioning doesn’t sound right since they’re absolute encoders

How long is your stub to your CANcoder?

I would double check soldering to the CANcoder and make sure you don’t have any stray strands of wire

Dimmer lights would be the result of lower voltage but I believe the cancoder has a LDO voltage regulator on them anyways so I’m not sure why that would be affected

Can you share some pictures?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-02-24T08:20:54.737Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":44.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":455892,"topic_slug":"kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56935,"username":"Domm","name":"That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domm/{size}/220499_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/kracken-x60-canivore-compatibility-kraken-awg/455892/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3324888,"name":"That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic","username":"Domm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domm/{size}/220499_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T21:00:14.029Z","cooked":"

We figured out the issue! - The resistance on the CAN line was too little causing the motor controllers to give us hardware error codes and threw us off. Once we went through all of our connections and minimized how many extra splits off of our CAN line we had and our randomly placed resistors and took a more methodical approach to it worked just fine. Thank you all for the help-

have these deep cycle batteries that we use for practice sessions.
